The human system wants challenges.  It was designed for challenges.  It does not simply want comfort.

The mind thinks it only wants comfort because it sees so many advertisements that sell comfort as the ultimate good thing.  So it tries to comfort itself.  It avoids challenge. But challenge is where the joy is. And MIND-shifting is the ultimate challenge.

FOUR Ways Your Life Will Change( When You Learn to Shift Your Mind. By Steve Chandler

What is a mind shift, anyway? Someone gives you a beautiful sports car with a manual shift (the best kind) and you get in to drive. Why Would I Speak So Softly and Carefully?

These 10 CDs are a true success course in that they are meant to be internalized as if you had a big exam coming up and you were determined to know everything.

These programs were created to listen to at night or when you are driving,  out on a long walk, or resting in your bed.  They were not created as a quick pump-up.  Anthony Robbins and Richard Simmons are who you want if you want that kind of adrenaline rush.

These messages are designed to sink into your thinking slowly, gently and in a way that will shift you forever.

As you listen to the thoughts I deliver, allow your mind to driftÃ¢â‚¬â€allow yourself to take a side road away from the lesson and daydream about a new solution to an old problem that has just occurred to you.

Because the programs were delivered slowly and deliberately, you can play them over and over, especially at night as you are drifting off to sleep, so that the nexus between beta brain waves and alpha can be permeated with success.

What is success, really, but knowing how to operate your mind?  Like any other complex device, you will want to learn this process called mind-shifting very carefully and completely.  When someone is explaining a difficult function on your computer to you, don't you appreciate it when they slow their words down?

Some people confuse success with being externally motivated.  Having some person or some drug, even, pump them up.  The problem with that kind of short-term stimulus is that it doesn't last and, in fact, it leaves, the user worse off in the end.

The perfect way to learn is through repetition.  Your mind is at its most open, teachable state when it's relaxed. The mind that is open will shift.
